content:
Hi there, I'm the Co-founder of Creatures for Kamala, a grassroots campaign to elect Vice President Harris.

We'd like to host a community event to increase awareness of our campaign and help get out the vote. 

I see a lot of organizations shown on the event website: https://events.democrats.org/ 

How does an organization get added to the system? I'd love to be included!

Hi <@1272583070087643180> ! Please give me a moment to grab a link for you. In the meantime, would you mind removing the link to your organization from your post? We have a channel specifically for outside events and links at <#1268426751164551199>. Thanks so much!

Ok, Here's a link to the event hosting form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScsAZ3wde3d_2QYSm1sp9-aX9POqY6mqppfHfXxubbCLrNYdQ/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0
I've added you to our Hosts so you should now have access to that section, including <#1245826306780823563> ; they should be able to answer any further questions you may have regarding hosting events! Thanks so much for putting this all together!!
(As a side note, judging by the name of your group, you may be interested in one of our newer channels <#1271922058250555444> üò∏ )

<@1272583070087643180> The approval process using Mobilize's template for [Community Events](https://events.democrats.org/c/host-a-relational-event/event/create/) would be faster, because the DNC would need to manually verify events submitted using Google Forms (data-entry into Mobilize).
You're welcome!  The Google Form is intended for events that don't fit the Mobilize templates, but its approval process is slow.
